item.title: How the Enlightenment Ends [Henry Kissinger]
item.description: Horsemen of the End of Enlightenment Kissinger’s waking call was the triumph of AlphaGo. He is wary of the self-learning machine. The printing press sparked the Age of Reason. However, a world reliant on data & algorithms, uncontrollable by ethical/philosophical norms will upend the Age of Reason. The people developing AI care more about technical feats than ethical/philosophical issues. Harbingers of the end of enlightenment: information overload diverts people from introspection, ability to target micro-groups breaks up the previous consensus on priorities.
